chapter.title: Storage Domains
chapter.para:
The storage domain specific elements which may be contained in the storage domain description are as follows:
type One of DATA, ISO or EXPORT
status One of ACTIVE, INACTIVE, LOCKED, MIXED, UNATTACHED and UNINITIALIZED
storage Describes the underlying storage of the storage domain. See below.
master true if this is the master storage domain of a data center
host A reference to the host on which this storage domain should be initialized. The only restriction on this host is that it should have access to the physical storage specified.
The storage element has a type element with the physical storage type and a number of elements specific to that storage type. The NFS specific elements are:
address The host name or IP address of the NFS server
path The path of NFS mountable directory on the server
For example:
When creating a new storage domain, the name, type, storage and host elements are required. The host may be identified by either id or name. Only the name element may be updated post-creation.
Once a storage domain has been initialized it can be attached to a data center. See .
The storage domain actions block may report the availability of a teardown action, which must be invoked before the storage domain can be deleted.

section.title: iSCSI and FCP
section.para:
The iSCSI and FCP specific elements in a storage description are:
logical_unit id A storage domain may be composed of multiple iSCSI or FCP logical units
volume_group id Alternatively, a storage domain may be based on a single LVM Volume Group which, in turn, may be composed of multiple iSCSI or FCP logical units
See for more details.

In the case of iSCSI, if a logical_unit description also contains details of the iSCSI target containing the LUN in question, the target will be automatically logged into when the storage domain is created.

section.title: Teardown Action
section.para: The teardown removes the storage domain from the physical storage. A host (identified by id or name) which has physical access to the storage must be supplied.
A storage domain must be detached from all data centers before it can be torn down. See .

section.title: Activate Action
section.para: An attached storage domain must be activated before it the may be used. The activate action does not take any action specific parameters.

section.title: Deactivate Action
section.para: An attached storage domain must be deactivated before it can be removed. The deactivate action does not take any action specific parameters.
